item.title: A Lightweight Formalism for Reference Lifetimes and Borrowing in Rust
item.description: Abstract. Rust is a relatively new programming language which has gained significant traction since its v1.0 release in 2015. Rust aims to be a systems language that competes with C/C++. A claimed advantage of Rust is a strong focus on memory safety without garbage collection.
